body_html:
BTW, "persistent tensors" reuse the same machinery as partial run but are a bit easier/more explicit, here's an example of using it: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37644984/run-train-op-multiple-times-in-tensorflow/37736888#37736888

You can dequeue some value and save it as persistent tensor, and then reuse it in next session run. This does not trigger fetching/transferring tensor contents from TensorFlow runtime

body:
BTW, "persistent tensors" reuse the same machinery as partial run but are a bit easier/more explicit, here's an example of using it: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37644984/run-train-op-multiple-times-in-tensorflow/37736888#37736888

You can dequeue some value and save it as persistent tensor, and then reuse it in next session run. This does not trigger fetching/transferring tensor contents from TensorFlow runtime
